incidents.name: Users may get logged out of their Atlassian accounts

incident_updates.body: We are investigating an incident impacting Jira Cloud, Confluence Cloud, Bitbucket Cloud, and Statuspage. During our investigation, users may be logged out of their accounts as we work towards a resolution. We are continuing to investigate and will update this incident with more details as they are available.

scheduled_maintenances.name: Storage infrastructure maintenance - repositories briefly read-only

incident_updates.body:
The Bitbucket team will be performing maintenance to improve our storage infrastructure. To minimize disruption, maintenance will be performed during weekends in May, June, and July 2021 (21:00 Friday - 23:00 Sunday UTC). This maintenance window on May 7 will be shorter.

A subset of repositories and snippets will be processed every weekend. Each individual repository/snippet will be in a read-only state for a period of time. An active repository/snippet will be read-only for up to 30 minutes. An inactive one will be read-only for up to 4 hours.

While a repository/snippet is read-only, it cannot be modified via Bitbucket Cloud Services, including the Website, Git operations via SSH and HTTPS, API requests, and Pipelines. During this period, a git push will fail with the message “Repository is in read only mode.”

All services are expected to be back to normal after this maintenance is complete.

scheduled_maintenances.name: Database infrastructure maintenance. Two hours of downtime scheduled

incident_updates.body:
The Bitbucket team will be performing maintenance in our database infrastructure over the May 8th weekend.  This maintenance will require up to 2 hours of downtime on all Bitbucket Cloud Services, including the Website, Git operations via SSH and HTTPS, API requests, and Pipelines. All services are expected to be back to normal after this maintenance is complete.

We will update this maintenance announcement on April 27th, 2021 with the exact time when this maintenance will begin.
